## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
source("http://www.sthda.com/upload/rquery_cormat.r")
MyData = read.csv(file = "../dataset/Toddler Autism dataset July 2018.csv", header = TRUE, sep= ",")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
mydata <- MyData[, c(2:11)]

head(mydata)
col<- colorRampPalette(c("blue", "white", "red"))(20)
cormat<-rquery.cormat(mydata, type="full", col=col)
mydata2 = MyData[MyData[, 19] == "Yes", c(2:11)]
mydata3 = MyData[MyData[, 19] == "No", c(2:11)]
col<- colorRampPalette(c("blue", "white", "red"))(20)
cormat<-rquery.cormat(mydata2, type="full", col=col)
cormat<-rquery.cormat(mydata3, type="full", col=col)
library(beeswarm)
```
```{r}
hist(MyData[, 12])
hist(MyData[MyData[, 19] == "Yes", 12])
hist(MyData[MyData[, 19] == "No", 12])
```
```{r}
library(beanplot)
beanplot(mydata, bw = 'nrd0')
beanplot(mydata2, bw = 'nrd0')
beanplot(mydata3)



```
